channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: You Love Your Dog. Should She Be in Your Will?
item.description: The rise of the “pet directive” lets anyone plan for their animals, not just the wealthy.

item.title: My mother’s will leaves everything to her 3 children. My brother died suddenly — and his wife says she will receive her late husband’s share
item.description: ‘Our spouses are not mentioned in her will and she was not a popular member of our family’

item.title: What Should You Do With Your 401(k) When You Retire?
item.description: Do you roll it over into an IRA? Or leave it where it is? Here’s how to decide.

item.title: A pill that reverses Alzheimer’s disease? This medical breakthrough shows promise.
item.description: Research at UCLA shows restored brain function and memory.

item.title: Intel: Too Big to Turn, Too Vital to Fail
item.description: The company’s position as the largest chip manufacturer in the U.S. likely ensures its survival, but in what form is far from clear.

item.title: ‘I feel slighted’: My husband and I are in our 70s. We married 3 years ago. He’s leaving his $1.8 million home to a 10-year-old relative. Is that normal?
item.description: ‘I have almost double his pension income, as his former wives took a considerable share’

item.title: Welcome to Y'all Street, Texas' Burgeoning Financial Hub
item.description: Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan and others are lured to the state by lower taxes and housing costs and a friendlier vibe.

item.title: ‘My stepmother makes me feel unwelcome’: I bought a house for my father in 2008, but now he wants me to sign over a 50% share for his third wife
item.description: “He has been married to his third wife for three years; she has asked him where she will live when he passes.”

item.title: Market Turmoil Revives Age-Old Question: Should You Buy the Dip?
item.description: Many have been rewarded for buying into declines in recent years.

item.title: The U.S. economy is getting closer to a recession. What is the Fed waiting for?
item.description: The Fed should cut rates by 0.5% before the Jackson Hole meeting in late August, says Investment manager Louis Navellier.
